intro: Villarsia parnassiifolia, commonly known as the Parnassian fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are bi-lobed and have a distinctive, lace-like appearance. It thrives in shaded, moist conditions and is often found in montane rainforests.
